mods.abstract: Pre-Columbian ceramic figure, possibly of a woman as there is some evidence of breasts but the figure is too worn to tell with certainty. The figure is also adorned with ear spools, a necklace and a simple headdress. The figure only depicts to about waist level but there are arms.
The figure is fairly worn with most details, especially facial, being too worn to completely make out. Other than that there is some chipping in different places.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian figurines
Pre-Columbian cultural artifacts
George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
Special Collections
George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
